headline: Why Hewlett Packard Enterprise Stock Jumped Today
summary: HPE settled DOJ antitrust litigation over its $14 billion Juniper Networks acquisition, avoiding trial.  The settlement requires HPE to divest its Instant On wireless business and license Juniper's Mist AI code.  Shares of Hewlett-Packard Enterprise (NYSE: HPE) were up on Monday, finishing the day up 11.4%.

headline: Way clear for Hewlett Packard Enterprise's $14B acquisition of Juniper after Justice Dept settlement
summary: Hewlett Packard Enterprise has reached a settlement with the Justice Department that could clear the way for its $14 billion takeover of rival Juniper Networks.  The Justice Department had sued to block the acquisition, saying it could eliminate competition, raise prices and reduce innovation.  The settlement, which is subject to court approval, calls for Hewlett Packard Enterprise to divest its global Instant On campus and branch business.

raw.headline: Way clear for Hewlett Packard Enterprise's $14B acquisition of Juniper after Justice Dept settlement
raw.summary: Hewlett Packard Enterprise has reached a settlement with the Justice Department that could clear the way for its $14 billion takeover of rival Juniper Networks.  The Justice Department had sued to block the acquisition, saying it could eliminate competition, raise prices and reduce innovation.  The settlement, which is subject to court approval, calls for Hewlett Packard Enterprise to divest its global Instant On campus and branch business.

headline: Solar stocks, Moderna, HPE: Trending Tickers
summary: Solar stocks such as Enphase (ENPH), SunRun (RUN), and SolarEdge (SEDG) are in focus as changes to the big beautiful bill could introduce new taxes on the industry. Moderna (MRNA) sees promising drug trial results for its combination flu shot and COVID-19 vaccine. HPE (HPE) has reached a settlement with the Department of Justice to allow it to proceed with its $14 billion acquisition of Juniper Networks (JNPR). Check out Yahoo Finance's interview with HPE CEO Antonio Neri here. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief here.
